2. In a ripple carry adder, which of the following is not the correct representation of any of the intermediate outputs(output after every intermediate gate) or final outputs that are present at each stage of the adder:

answers.d: (A AND B) OR (Cin AND (A XOR B))

explanations.a: The Sum outputs of the full adders at each stage in a ripple carry adder are calculated as: SUM = A XOR B XOR Cin
explanations.b: In each full adder of a ripple carry adder, ((A XOR B) AND Cin), (A AND B) are given as inputs to an OR Gate to get the Carry Output of that full adder.
explanations.c: None of the intermediary or final stages/gates in a ripple carry adder output this boolean expression.
explanations.d: In each full adder of a ripple carry adder, ((A XOR B) AND Cin), (A AND B) are given as inputs to an OR Gate to get the Carry Output of that full adder. So, CarryOut = (A AND B) OR (Cin AND (A XOR B)) for each full adder.
